item.title: Processing Binary Protocols with Client-Side JavaScript
item.description: Last couple of weeks I’m trying to build high-performance consumption of binary protocol through the browser. The protocol is running over TCP. In the perfect world I’d be talking with the remote TCP server, through TCP sockets, connecting directly from the client-side JavaScript and consuming the received binary data. Because of limitations of the client-side API, JavaScript doesn’t has access to plain TCP sockets, there’s no full happiness. The second best option would be to use intermediate proxy, which:
